author: mr philip stephenson
text:
The company used to be good till a few months ago, My wife has an account with them for a few years, trusted seller, good reviews on her, and suddenly she cant do direct shipping, but her items have to be sent to them for verification.
Contacting their customer care, a week ago they sad it was a technical issue, and today at first they sad she was right, then after a few minutes they sad its their policy, which when challenged to it they were going round with their templated replies, they were not able to advise where in their policies, and obviously their T&C to which a buyer and seller has access, there is mention of a trusted seller and highly ranked, can not do direct shipping.
Overall the CS team are crap, provide templated replies, and at the end end up closing the chat to get rid of you.
The only lie about this review is the 1 star I gave them, as they deserve no stars at all, but trust pilot does not allow a 0 star review or what they deserve a negative star
title: Crappy customer care, not able of giving a proper reply to your question

author: Nena Chichi
text:
I bought a Celine bag. When I received it, it wasn't in the condition advertised (had massive interior stains), the measures were not as advertised (bag was smaller), but the most important thing, it was a replica (fake). I know there are very good replicas in the market that are hard to identify, but was one of the bad ones, it even didn't have the number on  zippers or a the code written in the internal pocket tag (Celine authenticity review 101), the logo was poorly printed. So I raised an authenticity claim to Vestiaire, they immediately accepted to review it again. After a couple of days, they sent me an e mail saying that I'll receive a full refund. Until then, everything was kind of OK, people make mistakes, BUT then I noticed that they uploaded the bag on the site again (Vestiaire was the "seller" in this case) and then I noticed it was sold it with 25% discount. 
How can you resell a bag that you know its fake and you have confirmed that to other buyer? 
I really hope this review helps to make people aware that Vestiaire is not fully trustable and you have to carefully review your item as soon as you receive it.
I also hope that the person that bought this bag (grey with fuccia accents), review it carefully before accepting it!
title: VC confirmed bag as fake, then put on sale again

author: Tina
text: I sold an item in new condition. Sent it to the buyer who then reported stains and a dent in the item. The pictures of my item clearly showed no marks but the buyervis now able to return the item to me in a damaged condition. Its not a case of buyer beware it should be seller beware
title: I sold an item in new condition

author: Mati Webster
text:
I sold an item on Vestiaire. I sent the bag into their headquarters to authenticate it, I got no notification on the status of the bag apart from "non-compliant" on my payment section, no email or notification was sent as to why. When I further inquired about this you have to speak to an automated help system for so long before you can get through to anyone. They told me the bag was non-compliant because of a scratch on the corner, allowing me to relist it if I chose to. Over a week later, it still has not been relisted and I am again having to go through the automated system to speak to anyone about it. They have responded that they have not yet looked into relisting the item - even weeks after. Awful service - expect fast and helpful staff when they are holding items potentially worth thousands of pounds at their headquarters, and taking such a large cut of it. Completely unprofessional and not transparent on the status of the items you're selling - especially when the items are no longer in your hands.

My experience as a buyer even worse. I bought a t-shirt on Vestiaire in 2017 that showed up in 2019. I assumed an issue with the post office but Vestiaire had just forgotten to send it.
title: Unprofessional and slow service. Would not recommend.

author: Yulia
text:
I am writing this review because there's yet another issue with Vestiaire Collective which is managed completely atrociously.
A bit of background history: a customer purchased my item, I sent it to the warehouse and received a message almost instantaneously that it did not pass QC as it's a fake (despite item having brand's original markings and me providing copy of the receipt). After I submitted my comments on the item with the detailed explanation why it is authentic, I received response that it is indeed authentic but the sale was cancelled already and they are very sorry.
Everything that CS was able to offer me was resubmitting the item online which is absolutely unacceptable. Because of someone's incompetency, I have a fake item strike on my account, a buyer who received a message that the item she bought was a fake which is a horrible lie, no item, no money and no resolution of the situation.
I can tell you what has happened: someone just did not check the item properly (probably because he or she does not have required expertise) and cancelled the sale which ended up in severe consequences for me. 
And VC is keeping silent on this issue, the item is still listed as non compliant on my account affecting my submissions, my sales and my reputation, leave alone absence of both item and money.
Do you think this is okay? I don't think so. 
It has been over two weeks and they just stopped responding to me. No item, no money, nothing has been relisted. The last time I had an exchange with customer support and asked them to inform the buyer the item was actually compliant, they offered me to do it myself once item is relisted. How on Earth am I supposed to do this? Not even talking about them refusing to take responsibility for their own mistakes!
Please be warned this can happen to you as well. 

Item number 15050617. I demand Vestiaire Collective to refund me the money from this sale as what has been happening is completely unacceptable. No item, no money, just a gigantic fraud.
title: Ghastly ignorance and incompetence

author: Elsa
text:
I sold a dress on VC on the 24/12/20 which got lost during transit by UPS, and until today I still haven’t received any payment from VC after numerous chasing!!

I contacted UPS to try to locate the package but without success (basically they can’t help) because the shipping cost was paid directly by VC using their corporate account, so there’s nothing I could do to follow it up with UPS.

I was in contact with the buyer via the chat in the app to try to understand what had happened and trying to sort this out but VC subsequently blocked my chat function because I was trying to contact the buyer privately (and they refund to activate my chat function with other members after I contacted them explaining the situation). The buyer told me she has received a refund. 

I contacted VC at least five times the last three months and they have promised a payment date twice (3/2/21 and 15/3/21) but have missed them twice. The last time I contacted them on the 4/4/21 to say I will escalate if they don’t get back to me yet they have not responded so far.

It's hard for them to explain themselves they are not deliberately trying to avoid paying. They even removed the record of my sale from the app and I can't see it from my account anymore!

TL;DR - VC avoid to pay seller after the package got lost, yet pretending they are trying to pay. Broke promise twice and not responding to emails.
title: VC avoid to pay seller after the package got lost, yet pretending they are trying to pay

author: Sarah S
text: Quality in recent times has simply gone out of the window. Shocking Customer Support!
title: Quality in recent times has simply gone…

author: Carol Campbell
text: Terrible terrible customer service. The DHL Waybill provided by VC to send my sold item to the buyer does not work. DHL cannot collect it because the number doesn’t work on their system. VC refuse to provide their account number as an alternative (the solution proposed by DHL) and will not offer an alternative shipping method. You can’t speak to VC on the phone and the live chat is useless. This is the second shoddy experience I’ve had with them, it’s not worth the hassle. I have 2 abortive sales, 2 unhappy buyers and a lot of wasted time and stress. AVOID!
title: Terrible terrible customer service

author: MAlvarez
text: They do not regulate their sellers enough - some ‘professional’ seller continuing to sell fake goods even AFTER reporting it!
title: They do not regulate their sellers…

author: Elisabeth
text:
I have an issue with a product (jacket). It was described as in good condition, the pictures looked fine, however it came stained (someone ate spaghetti sauce on it) and it smells like 100 years old. Both of it is not in line with vestiaires standards. However, I contacted customer service now for three times for the lack of compliance with the description without receiving any answer to my first complaint and with an immediate answer, after the 72 hours have passed, stating, that "unfortunately nothing can be done as you are contacting us beyond the 72 hours". This is scam and I intend to take legal measures as I had the exact same problem with a different and expensive product. There is no customer protection whatsoever for the buyer if you buy "direct" and at the same time you charge the sellers an expensive fee - approximately 30 per cent or more, just for the listing on the page and the parcel pick-up. Turns out, that this is no better than listing your product directly on ebay.

p.s. message you sent to customer service are not saved, so you cannot follow up or see if something was answered. You need to contact them via the contact form each time anew. I also tried the chat box, when they told me "oh I see that your issue is still being looked into. we will be in touch". After almost two weeks passed, I do not believe in this any more.
title: Systematic scam..?

author: Maria
text: Just contacted customer service with an issue and the response was extremely unhelpful. It's really disappointing that for such a premium website the customer service is absolutely terrible. I wouldn't leave a negative review lightly as I understand one experience doesn't reflect everything on the company but this is the 3rd time I've contacted them with an issue and the reply was just completely useless and unhelpful. I guess I'll be taking my money and business somewhere else, I'm deeply disappointed.
title: Poor customer service for such a premium retailer

author: Martine Lawley
text:
I have been a member of the 'VC Community' 😂 for a number of years.
If you ask them for advice/support in their 'Chat' you get a very sweet person who is paid to apologise and talk to you about the 'Pandemic' but who has no idea how to help.
My most recent request was for a solid explanation as to why since 'Brexit' I cannot purchase a pair of Ugg slippers (I understand that there may be some restrictions between the 'World' and the UK, but when the seller of said slippers is a UK seller,  I am a UK buyer and I can access 'Direct Shipping' (this means the item will NOT leave the UK) I am not allowed to do so..   to me this is the epitomy of absurdity..  
I was quoted some reams of rules and regs which clearly do not apply to a UK to UK transaction.

And why are other sites (Rebelle,  Joli Closet,  VideDressing..  a german re-sale outlet and 2 French ones) do not apply such absurd rules?
Why is it that Ebay does not follow suit?

Vestiaire Collective is not trying to assist their customers but is ruling them in a system that is unhelpful and manipulative.
title: Vestiaire does not care about it's members/customers

Very dissatisfied and disappointed!
title: Poor customer service and poor…
